alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 11:33PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Los Angeles and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 230 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. There will be widespread ponding of water on area roadways and local flooding of low lying areas and intersections. Mudslides and rockslides are likely on canyon roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across the area. Rainfall rates were up to one third of an inch per hour. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Moderate to occasionally heavy rainfall will continue to produce minor flooding through early morning Wednesday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Malibu, Acton, Ojai, Burbank, Pasadena, Altadena, Chatsworth, Woodland Hills, Northridge, Encino, Van Nuys, Agoura Hills, Santa Clarita, North Hollywood and Santa Monica. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain, and near burn scars. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
